intro: Pedicularis spicata subsp. stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, often covered with a fine layer of hairs. This subspecies is noted for its unique floral structure and is often found in open, sunny habitats at high altitudes.
